wikipedia_page.main: Jeremy Robert Edward Campbell-Lamerton (born 21 February 1957 in Gibraltar) is a former Scottish national team international rugby union player.

response: Will Carling, Will Greenwood, and Marcus Rose are the most notable former undergraduates, all of whom made multiple appearances for England and participated in various editions of the Rugby World Cup. Richard Breakey and Jeremy Campbell-Lamerton were capped by Scotland, while Mark Griffin won several caps for the United States. Josh Basham, Stuart Legg and Ben Woods have all played club rugby for Newcastle Falcons. Another recent graduate, Fitz Harding, is signed to Bristol Bears.
* Jeremy Campbell-Lamerton (Hatfield) – former Scottish rugby union lock
* Jeremy Campbell-Lamerton, Scottish rugby union footballer

response: *Jeremy Campbell-Lamerton and Mike Campbell-Lamerton; Jeremy is Mike's son

Anglo-Scots: S. R. Irvine (London Scottish), J. C. W. Beazley (Edinburgh Wanderers), R. McLean (Gloucester), D. R. M. Bruce Lockhart (London Scottish), T. Paterson-Brown (London Scottish), C. Russell (Wasps), G. J. M. Irvine (Harrogate), P. Jones (Gloucester), I. Kirk (London Scottish), D. Butcher (Sale), Jeremy Campbell-Lamerton (London Scottish) [captain], Chris Gray (Nottingham), S. Smith (Gosforth), A. J. Macklin (London Scottish), Iain Morrison (London Scottish). Replacement: R. Cunningham (Wasps) for Macklin (44 minutes)

He finished his degree in 1978, receiving a 2.2. One of his classmates was the future broadcaster George Alagiah, while fellow undergraduates in the same cohort at Hatfield College included the rugby player Jeremy Campbell-Lamerton and Peter Waterworth, then Senior Man, and in later life Governor of Montserrat.Durham University Gazette, pp. 64–66
